body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlett
Govenor."

Your petitioners would respectfully state to you, that on or about the day of November 1865, one N B Ford was indicted by the grand jury of Caldwell County Kentucky, for shooting a negro man by the name of George Taylor, with intent to kill, the facts are believed to be this." That the said N B Ford caught the said negro with a hog of his." and asked the negro what he was going to do with his pig." and the negro said that it was his. I told him it was not his, but that it was Ford's hog. then the negro said it was ^Mr^ Chambers hog, and that Mr Chambers had told him it was his to catch it & carry it home, Ford then went to Chambers & asked him if he told the negro to catch the pig & Chambers ^said^ no he did not." & Ford went to correct the negro & the negro said a few cross words & broke to run, then it was Ford shot him." said negro has got entirely well and if ensist ^the^ negro has a bad character as a grand rascal &c
and if consistent with your views & opinions would request you to release him said Ford of the Indictment &c."

E Baker
Asst Ass Int. Rev
A. G. Ratliff
S. T. Mitchesson
B. T. Gray
J. W. Withers
H E Mitchesson
P H Darby
R. L. Wilson
